feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Cloud Application Programming Model
feed.subtitle: SAP Cloud Application Programming Model Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Entity returns duplicate value when used with filters, $top and $skip
entry.content:
We have a CAP Java backend (CAP Java SDK version 4.0.0) with Fiori elements frontend. We use the tree table component in our first list report page of our application. â€ƒ

Tree table in our application : 

So when loading the tree table frontend component, we do the following backend call : 

NameOfOurEntity$apply=orderby(numberOfMetrics%20desc)/com.sap.vocabularies.Hierarchy.v1.TopLevels(HierarchyNodes=$root/NameOfOurEntity,HierarchyQualifier='SystemHierarchy',NodeProperty='id')&$select=DistanceFromRoot,DrillState,LimitedDescendantCount,dataCollectionStatus,dataCollectionStatusLabel,id,name,numberOfMetrics,parentID&$count=true&$skip=0&$top=225

When we apply a filter the following call happens to our backend : 

NameOfOurEntity?$apply=ancestors($root/NameOfOurEntity,SystemHierarchy,id,filter(dataCollectionStatusLabel%20eq%20'NOT_CONFIGURED'),keep%20start)/orderby(numberOfMetrics%20desc)/com.sap.vocabularies.Hierarchy.v1.TopLevels(HierarchyNodes=$root/NameOfOurEntity,HierarchyQualifier='SystemHierarchy',NodeProperty='id')&$select=DistanceFromRoot,DrillState,LimitedDescendantCount,dataCollectionStatus,dataCollectionStatusLabel,id,name,numberOfMetrics,parentID&$count=true&$skip=0&$top=225

Our Backend Entity looks like this : 

 

entity TreeEntityTable as select distinct key id, name, parentID, numberOfMetrics, dataCollectionStatus,
  dataCollectionStatusLabel, serviceType
  from (
    select id, name, parentID, numberOfMetrics, dataCollectionStatus, dataCollectionStatusLabel, serviceType
    from SystemTypes union
    select id, name, parentID, numberOfMetrics, dataCollectionStatus, dataCollectionStatusLabel, serviceType
    from Systems union
    select id, name, parentID, numberOfMetrics, dataCollectionStatus, dataCollectionStatusLabel, serviceType
    from Clients union
    select id, name, parentID, numberOfMetrics, dataCollectionStatus, dataCollectionStatusLabel, serviceType
    from LanscapeObjects
  );
@Capabilities.FilterRestrictions.NonFilterableProperties: [
  'LimitedDescendantCount',
  'DistanceFromRoot',
  'DrillState',
  'LimitedRank',
  'dataCollectionStatus',
  'id',
  'numberOfMetrics',
  'parentID',
  'serviceType'
]
@Capabilities.SortRestrictions.NonSortableProperties: [
  'LimitedDescendantCount',
  'DistanceFromRoot',
  'DrillState',
  'LimitedRank',
  'dataCollectionStatus',
  'id',
  'parentID',
  'serviceType'
]
@cds.search: {
  id,
  name,
  dataCollectionStatusLabel,
  numberOfMetrics,
  serviceType
}
@readonly
entity TreeEntity as projection on TreeEntityTable {
  @title:'{i18n>ID}'
  key id,
  @title:'{i18n>SYSTEM_NAME}'
  name,
  @titl:'{i18n>NUMBER_OF_METRICS}'
  numberOfMetrics,
  @title:'{i18n>DATA_COLLECTION_STATUS}'
  dataCollectionStatus,
  @title:'{i18n>DATA_COLLECTION_STATUS_LABEL}'
  dataCollectionStatusLabel,
  parentID,
  serviceType,
  parent : Association to TreeEntity on parent.id = $self.parentID,
  children : Composition of many TreeEntity on children.parentID = $self.id,
  statusLabelRelation : Association to one TreeEntityTableLabels on statusLabelRelation.dataCollectionStatusLabel = $self.dataCollectionStatusLabel,
  virtual null as LimitedDescendantCount : Integer64,
  virtual null as DistanceFromRoot : Integer64,
  virtual null as DrillState : String,
  virtual null as LimitedRank : Integer64
};

We never expect our backend to return duplicate entries to our frontend but we have see that in few cases when a filter is applied which contains data with more than 1500 entries and when multiple calls to backend with different $top and $skip is fired our backend tends to return duplicate values.

Please do let us know if you have faced the same issue or if you have already come across a fix for it.

entry.title: Generate PDF form on S/4HANA Cloud, public edition from BTP app
entry.content:
Iâ€™m building a BTP CAP application which should retrieve the PDF printout of an Outbound Delivery (FDP_V2_DELIVERY_NOTE_V1 template )out of an S/4HANA Cloud, public edition system.

Since no direct API exists (like for billing documents Overview | Billing Document - Read, Cancel, GetPDF | SAP Business Accelerator Hub), as per my understanding Iâ€™m left with three options:

  1. Recreate the same form I have on S/4HANA on BTP with SAP Forms Service by Adobe
  2. Get the PDF directly from CA_OC_OUTPUT_REQUEST_SRV Service
  3. Create a small custom ABAP service to be called from BTP which, given a specific delivery number, could return a PDF

I tried all those routes, but couldnâ€™t succeed for various reasons:

  1. SAP Forms Service by Adobe
    1. it seems I canâ€™t reuse the layout I made since the service only accept only one file, whereas mine is comprised of a master form and a content for
    2. even if I could recreate it from scratch I don't know how I can get data out of the standard Data Provider (FDP_V2_DELIV_NOTE_LO_GLO_GEN_SRV) to pass it to the layout
  2. this does not seem to be a released API, therefore I think I could have a problem with Communication Arrangement technical user
  3. on Premise FM like â€˜FP_JOB_OPENâ€™ etc.. are obviously forbidden, so I tried with proper classes like cl_fp_form_reader like suggested in Note 3355397 - No support for custom form templates in S/4 HANA Cloud Developer Extensibility - SAP for Me, however,  since the form was created using Maintain Form Template App, I tried to create in ADT, but no standard Data Provider can be chosen and I canâ€™t even create my own copy with the proper annotations (as explained in note 3650179 - [2508] Cannot select data provider in ADT Form dialog - SAP for Me) because I canâ€™t open SEGW on a Public Cloud environment.

Iâ€™ve hit a dead end. Can someone share a tip?

entry.title: I am getting a blank page when I preview my RAP service binding in the BTP trial account.
entry.content:
TITLE:
UCON 403 Forbidden Error - "The request has been blocked by UCON" on OData Service

DESCRIPTION:
I am experiencing a 403 Forbidden error when trying to access an OData service through a Fiori application. The error message in the browser console states:

"The request has been blocked by UCON."

DETAILS:
- Error Code: 403 Forbidden
- Error Message: "The request has been blocked by UCON"
- Application URL: https://[your-system-url]/sap/bc/adt/businessservices/odatav2/feap/[service-details]/flp.html
- SAP Client: 100
- Language: EN
- Resource Endpoint: /sap/opu/odata/sap/Z[service-name]

ERROR DETAILS FROM BROWSER CONSOLE:
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 403 (Forbidden)
/sap/opu/odata/sap/Zâ€¦e&sap-language=EN:1

 

I am trying to display a list view by creating an entity on this service definition, and I have also created a service binding for it. 

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'demo'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
    serviceQuality: #X,
    sizeCategory: #S,
    dataClass: #MIXED
}
define view entity Zsam_demo as select from /dmo/connection
{
@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 10 ,label: 'CarrierId' }]
    key carrier_id as CarrierId,
@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 20 ,label: 'ConnectionId' }]
    key connection_id as ConnectionId,
    @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 30 ,label: 'AirportFromId' }]
    airport_from_id as AirportFromId,
    @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 40 ,label: 'AirportToId' }]
    airport_to_id as AirportToId,
    @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 50 ,label: 'DepartureTime' }]
    departure_time as DepartureTime, 
    @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 60 ,label: 'ArrivalTime' }]
    arrival_time as ArrivalTime
}
@EndUserText.label: 'demo'
define service Zssd_sam_demo {
  expose Zsam_demo;
}

 

Please let me know anyone know to how resolve the issue 

I tried everything â€” I even deleted my BTP instance and created a new one, but Iâ€™m still facing the same issue.

entry.title: sap cap app template generator crashing with env.on error
entry.content: sap cap app template generator crashing with env.on error

entry.title: Ask for roadmap for CAP JAVA support for attachments in Object Store
entry.content:
Hello CAP team,

I am delighted to see in the CAP August 2025 release, there is an alpha version release for attachment to the object store service.

However, multi-tenancy is not supported in this version, so we can hardly use this feature in production.

So may I kindly ask the roadmap for this feature? Will multi-tenancy be supported in the future? When can we expect the support to be released?

entry.title: sap datasphere consumption view - can it update data into table
entry.content: I am doing the below blog. https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/card/510aefc5-a8a5-413d-88c5-90d9a3e3f3f7 We have requirement to create Fiori app to update Tables in datasphere present in space. 1. Can I use this consumption view and using user service - update the table somehow ? 2. Do I need to use the underlying table and expose it to the CAP application and then try to update it - is it possible ? Any pointers on the original requirements will also be helpful.

entry.title: How to get all input fields from a fragment without using their IDs
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I know that getValue()works with specific control IDs, but I would like to retrieve all the input fields from a fragment without accessing each one by its ID.

Is there a recommended way to achieve this in SAPUI5?

Kind regards,
Lein

entry.content:

entry.title: External API call from CAP project in BAS
entry.content:
Hi All ,

i am trying to call external API in CAP project "API_BUSINESS_PARTNER"

i am getting  response but no data 

{"@odata.context":"$metadata#A_BusinessPartner","value":[]}".

Service.cds

using { API_BUSINESS_PARTNER as abp } from './external/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER.csn';

service BusinessService {  
    entity A_BusinessPartner as projection on abp.A_BusinessPartner {
        key BusinessPartner, Customer, BusinessPartnerFullName, BusinessPartnerGrouping, BusinessPartnerUUID, OrganizationBPName1     }
}

Service.js

const cds = require('@sap/cds');
module.exports = cds.service.impl( async function() {
    const bp = await cds.connect.to('API_BUSINESS_PARTNER');    
    this.on('READ', 'A_BusinessPartner', async req => {        
        return bp.run(req.query);       
    });
})

package.json

{
  "name": "new",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "A simple CAP project.",
  "dependencies": {
    "@cap-js/hana": "^2",
    "@sap-cloud-sdk/connectivity": "^4.1.2",
    "@sap-cloud-sdk/http-client": "^4.1.2",
    "@sap-cloud-sdk/resilience": "^4.1.2",
    "@sap-cloud-sdk/util": "^4.1.2",
    "@sap/cds": "^9",
    "express": "^4"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@cap-js/sqlite": "^2",
    "@sap/cds-dk": "^9"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "start": "cds-serve"
  },
  "private": true,
  "cds": {
    "requires": {
      "API_BUSINESS_PARTNER": {
        "kind": "odata-v2",
        "model": "srv/external/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER",
        "credentials": {
          "url": "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER",
          "headers": {
            "APIKey": "xBKJfJi0dg1AdpCGLYv88WVdFEEy78GP"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

 Thanks,

Phani

entry.title: SAP HANA DB replication task, projection mapping
entry.content:
Hi All, 

I have a rather simple Replication task using SDI to retrieve data from ERP Backend as a Virtual table and want to map this to a column table on Hana Cloud. This is working ok.

I'm using the Hana Native artifact  *.hdbreptask GUID to achieve the above and more specific the projection here to do the needed mapping of fields. 

And here is my simple requirement/question.

How to map

  • from a source_date NVARCHAR(8) date - example '19991231' 
  • to  target_date of Date type - example  '1999-12-31'. 

This should be very simple, but I cannot figure out the syntax ðŸ˜ž

What did I try until now.

I tried to use TO_DATE function for this ( example TO_DATA("source_date", 'YYYYMMDDÂ´)), but I cannot get a valid syntax to achieve this..

entry.title: How can I exclude CAP sample data from deployment to production?
entry.content:
Hi,

I have setup a cap application connected to a hana database. We deploy via mta.yaml to cloud foundry.

For local development we want to use sample data, but I want to exclude it from deployment to our uat and production environment. 

We have a spring boot java application and for database deployment use typical node based database deployers.

- name:product-api-db-deployer
  type: hdb
  path: db
  parameters:
    buildpack: nodejs_buildpack
  requires:
    - name: product-api-db
  build-parameters:
    builder: custom
    commands:
      - npm run build

I understand that with cdsrc.json or package.json some environment specific settings can be configured, but I don't know how to exclude our sample data with that.  Also I only want to exclude the sample data, not the schema updates.

We have the standard folder structure for database and sample data:

Cheers!

entry.title: Perform CRUD operation from SAP BTP BAS on Datasphere.
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

Weâ€™re working on a BAS (CAPM) application and aiming to perform full CRUD operations using data from SAP Datasphere.

While weâ€™ve successfully implemented the read (fetch) functionality using the architecture shown below, weâ€™re currently facing challenges with enabling create, update, and delete operations directly on Datasphere tables.

 

 

Weâ€™d really appreciate any guidance, resources, or architectural suggestions that could help us achieve this. If anyone has experience or insights on enabling write operations with Datasphere from BAS, your support would be invaluable!

 

SAP Datasphere SAP Cloud Application Programming Model  SAP Fiori Cloud  

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Question about running Job from Subaccount B to Application in Subaccount A
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a request to run a Job in subaccount B that calls an endpoint from an application in subaccount A in BTP.

Running Jobs within the same subaccount works correctly, but when I try from another subaccount, I get a 401 error with the client ID.

Iâ€™ve read about multitenancy, but from what I understand, in those cases the multitenant application has the Job service bound in the same subaccount.

Is it mandatory to bind the service, or is it possible to support the B â†’ A scenario without the service being bound?

Thanks and regards

SAP Cloud Application Programming Model SAP Job Scheduling service

entry.title: Issue when customizing URLs for UI and SRV in CAP application deployed to Cloud Foundry
entry.content:
Hi CAP team,

Iâ€™m following the CAP bookshop example and successfully deployed the application to Cloud Foundry with both UI (AppRouter) and SRV modules.
Everything works correctly with the default route configuration.

However, after changing the URLs to custom routes for both the UI and SRV modules, the UI no longer loads the data from the SRV.
In the previous (default URLs) configuration, the data was shown correctly.

The data is loaded from a CSV file in the db/data folder.

Custom URLs used:

  • UI: https://cf.bookshop.playground.live.pu.ugw.cloud.sap
  • SRV: https://srv.bookshop.playground.live.pu.ugw.cloud.sap

Steps to reproduce

  1. Clone this repository: https://github.tools.sap/api-gateway/bookshop-mta
  2. Deploy the application to Cloud Foundry with the default MTA configuration - works as expected.
  3. Update mta.yaml to define the custom routes above for both the UI and SRV modules.
  4. Redeploy the app - the UI loads, but data from the SRV is not shown.

Expected behavior
The UI should still display the data from the SRV even when using the custom routes.

Actual behavior
The UI loads, but no data is displayed from the SRV when custom URLs are used.

Additional context

  • The data is static and comes from CSV files in db/data.
  • The issue seems to be related to the destination or routing configuration between AppRouter and SRV.

entry.title: Extending Entitlements for aem-validation-service-plan Across Subaccounts
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We are implementing a CAP service that needs to send and receive events to and from SAP Advanced Event Mesh (AEM). We have followed the configuration steps described in the official SAP documentation:

CAP Plugin for SAP Integration Suite - Advanced Event Mesh

 

In our setup, the CAP service is deployed in a different subaccount from the one where Advanced Event Mesh is provisioned. According to the documentation, the configuration requires a service binding to an instance of SAP Integration Suite (aem-validation-service-plan) to obtain the handshake API endpoint (URI).

However, since the AEM instance exists in a different subaccount, itâ€™s not possible to directly bind the CAP service to this instance.

We would like to clarify:

 

  1. Whether it is possible to extend the entitlements for the subaccount hosting our CAP application to include the aem-validation-service-plan from Advanced Event Mesh.

  2. If such an extension is possible, would there be any additional cost implications associated with enabling this plan in the CAP applicationâ€™s subaccount?

Thank you in advance for your assistance.

Best regards,
Oleksii

entry.title: Difference between events 'CREATE' , 'INSERT' custom handlers CAP Node.js
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
Can you please help me with the difference between the events CREATE and INSERT? When should I use each one, and what is the best practice? Also, what is the standard sequence of invocation? Based on my debugging, it appears that whichever event handler is implemented first is the one invoked first.

this.before('CREATE', Properties, async (req) => {
}

this.before('INSERT', Properties, async (req) => {
}

Best regards,
Ramjee Korada
